meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unusual or unexpected.
meanings.sent1: The unwontedness of the situation caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent2: Her unwontedness to wear bright colors made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The unwontedness of a cat walking on its hind legs would surely make anyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unwontedness of the silence in the bustling city was eerie.
meanings.sent5: The unwontedness of the rainbow at night was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of being out of the ordinary or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: The unwontedness of his behavior puzzled his friends.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of unwontedness when visiting a foreign country for the first time.
meanings.sent3: The unwontedness of a penguin in the desert would be quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The unwontedness of the clock ticking backwards was disorienting.
meanings.sent5: The unwontedness of the snow in summer was truly bizarre.
